articles.title: Meet the new Nextdoor: more useful, more helpful, and more timely
articles.summary: Nextdoor Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: KIND) has released a significant redesign of its platform, focusing on three core features: Alerts, News, and Faves. This update aims to make the Nextdoor experience more useful, helpful, and timely for its 100 million-plus users. The redesign includes real-time alerts for safety and preparedness, integrated local news from trusted sources, and an AI-powered "Faves" feature for personalized recommendations.

articles.title: MP Materials and Apple Announce $500 Million Partnership to Produce Recycled Rare Earth Magnets in the United States
articles.summary: MP Materials announced a $500 million long-term partnership with Apple to supply rare earth magnets made from 100 percent recycled materials. This agreement will enable MP Materials to expand its Fort Worth, Texas, factory and establish a dedicated recycling line at its Mountain Pass site, providing Apple with domestically sourced magnets for its products starting in 2027. The collaboration aims to strengthen U.S. manufacturing, advance circular supply chains, and reduce waste by recovering rare earth elements from recycled materials.

articles.title: Should You Be Impressed By 3 E Network Technology Group Limited's (NASDAQ:MASK) ROE?
articles.summary: This article analyzes the Return On Equity (ROE) of 3 E Network Technology Group Limited (NASDAQ:MASK), highlighting its impressive 51% ROE compared to the IT industry average of 11%. The company's low debt-to-equity ratio of 0.023 further suggests high business quality and effective use of capital without excessive leverage. While ROE is a key metric, the report advises considering other factors like profit growth rates and stock valuation.

articles.title: XYLD: A Blend Of Ultra-High Yield And AI-Driven Growth (NYSEARCA:XYLD)
articles.summary: The article discusses the Global X S&P 500 Covered Call ETF (XYLD), highlighting its ultra-high yield of 13% and significant exposure to AI and technology trends through major holdings like Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple. It suggests XYLD is suitable for income-focused investors seeking growth with S&P 500 diversification and a strong tech tilt, emphasizing its long track record since 2013.

articles.title: 4 Charts on Nvidia’s Record $4 Trillion Market Cap
articles.summary: Nvidia has achieved a record-breaking $4 trillion market capitalization, becoming the first company to reach this valuation thanks to the booming demand for AI hardware and software. Shares of the semiconductor giant have rocketed 280% over the past two years, largely outperforming the broader market and other tech giants like Microsoft and Apple. Despite new competition, Morningstar analysts believe Nvidia will remain dominant in the AI market, with the company currently rated as fairly valued.

articles.title: Agena Joel, general counsel at Playstudios, sells $14k in shares
articles.summary: Playstudios' General Counsel, Agena Joel, sold 11,489 shares of company stock for $14,131, at an average price of $1.23 per share. This transaction was executed under a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The company (NASDAQ: MYPS) has a market cap of $159 million, is trading at 0.65 times book value, and has a current ratio of 3.6.

articles.title: Should Fidelity Quality Factor ETF (FQAL) Be on Your Investing Radar?
articles.summary: The Fidelity Quality Factor ETF (FQAL) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market, with over $1.05 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.16%. It holds a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy) and has shown strong performance, returning 7.89% year-to-date and 14.09% over the last year. The fund's top holdings include major tech companies like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple, primarily focusing on the Information Technology sector.

articles.title: Nvidia's $4 trillion milestone caps rise of stock market behemoth
articles.summary: Nvidia Corp reached a $4 trillion market valuation, highlighting its significant importance in the stock market and the technology sector, driven by a massive surge in its stock price since late 2022. This milestone gives Nvidia the largest weight in the S&P 500 and reflects the growing influence of tech companies, which now comprise one-third of the S&P 500's market value. Other tech giants like Microsoft and Apple are also nearing or exceeding the $3 trillion mark, underscoring the dominance of technology in current market valuations.

articles.title: Christopher D. Brown Joins 908 Devices’ Board
articles.summary: Christopher D. Brown, co-founder of 908 Devices Inc., has been appointed to the company's board of directors. Brown previously served as the company's chief technology officer and vice president of Research & Development, and most recently as chief product officer until Repligen Corporation acquired 908 Devices’ bioprocessing portfolio. His extensive experience in advanced analytical technologies and innovation will be a valuable asset to the board.

articles.title: Nvidia briefly becomes the first $4 trillion company. How it beat Microsoft and Apple to the crown.
articles.summary: Nvidia briefly achieved an intraday market capitalization of $4 trillion on Wednesday, making it the first U.S. company to reach this milestone. Although its stock pulled back to close just below the $4 trillion mark, Nvidia still set a new record for the highest closing market cap ever at $3.974 trillion, surpassing Apple's previous record. The company's stock touched $164.42 intraday but ended the day at $162.88, slightly below the $163.93 needed to close above the $4 trillion threshold.

articles.title: Nvidia briefly becomes the first $4 trillion company. How it beat Microsoft and Apple to the crown.
articles.summary: Nvidia briefly achieved a $4 trillion intraday market capitalization on Wednesday, becoming the first U.S. company to do so. Although its shares pulled back slightly by the close, ending just below the milestone, Nvidia still set a new record for the highest closing market cap ever at $3.974 trillion, surpassing Apple's previous record. The company's stock reached an intraday high of $164.42, demonstrating its significant market growth.

articles.title: Nvidia becomes first company to reach $4tn in market value
articles.summary: Nvidia has become the first public company in history to achieve a $4tn market valuation, with its stock price rising roughly 2.4% to $164. This significant milestone is attributed to the ongoing surge in demand for artificial intelligence technologies, where Nvidia's chips and software are considered industry leaders. The company's market value has more than tripled in about a year, outpacing giants like Apple and Microsoft in growth speed.

articles.title: Nvidia becomes first company to hit $4 trillion valuation
articles.summary: Nvidia became the first company to reach a $4 trillion valuation, momentarily surpassing Apple's previous record, driven by surging demand for its AI chips. Despite closing slightly shy of $4 trillion, the milestone highlights its explosive growth and central role in the AI revolution, even as it navigates challenges like Chinese export restrictions. The company has seen its market value climb significantly in recent years, outranking other tech giants like Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta.

articles.title: Procter & Gamble Stock Price Forecast PG Surges to $150.37 After Earnings Beat,Upside Toward $171
articles.summary: The article focuses on the OMAH ETF, which offers a 14.88% annualized yield by combining 20 of Berkshire Hathaway's largest equity stakes with an active covered call strategy. Despite its short track record, OMAH has outperformed BRK.B and maintained capital stability during volatile periods. The fund targets income-seeking investors, balancing high yield with a diversified, defensively tilted portfolio.

articles.title: Leawood’s Town Center Crossing and Town Center Plaza shopping centers get new owners
articles.summary: Federal Realty Investment Trust has acquired Leawood's Town Center Plaza and Town Center Crossing shopping centers, marking their first Midwest purchase. The Bethesda, Maryland-based company, which primarily operates on the East and West coasts, plans long-term investment and upgrades for the combined 730,000 square feet of retail space. Leawood city leaders welcomed the new owners, expressing excitement for potential improvements and new brands, especially considering the shopping centers' previous owner declared bankruptcy in 2021.

articles.title: Nvidia becomes first US company to reach $4 trillion market cap
articles.summary: Nvidia has become the first public company globally to achieve a $4 trillion market capitalization, driven by soaring demand for artificial intelligence technologies. This milestone solidifies its position as a top-performing stock, surpassing Apple and Microsoft in market value growth speed. The company's impressive financial performance and market weight on the S&P 500 highlight Wall Street's confidence in the future of AI.

articles.title: VGT ETF Explained: Is It the Best Tech Investment Today?
articles.summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT), evaluating its framework, effectiveness, and potential risks as a tech investment. It details VGT's holdings, performance against the S&P 500, and compares it to other popular tech ETFs like XLK, QQQ, and FTEC. The piece concludes that VGT is a strong candidate for a core tech holding in a growth-oriented portfolio due to its diversified, low-cost structure and alignment with innovation, despite its inherent volatility.

articles.title: This Is Why I Would Buy SPXL
articles.summary: The Direxion Daily S&P 500 Bull 3X Shares ETF (SPXL) offers triple-magnified exposure to the S&P 500, making it an attractive option for investors seeking aggressive growth. While highly volatile due to its leverage and daily rebalancing, the author suggests SPXL can be used safely by limiting its allocation in a portfolio and balancing it with un-leveraged ETFs like SPY. The article highlights SPXL's historical performance, quarterly dividends, and the importance of using it cautiously within a diversified strategy.

articles.title: Adams Diversified Equity Fund, Inc. Reports 7.8% Net Asset Value Return for H1 2025
articles.summary: Adams Diversified Equity Fund, Inc. reported a 7.8% net asset value return for the first half of 2025, outperforming the S&P 500 and Morningstar U.S. Large Blend category. The fund's market price return was 12.4%, with net assets of approximately $2.8 billion as of June 30, 2025, and significant holdings in technology companies like Microsoft and NVIDIA. The company also highlighted its consistent dividend history, targeting an annual distribution rate of at least 8% of NAV.

articles.title: TikTok integrates another streaming service into Add to Music App feature, with Anghami partnership
articles.summary: TikTok has partnered with Anghami, a leading streaming service in the Middle East and North Africa, to integrate it into its 'Add to Music App' feature. This allows users in the MENA region to directly save tracks discovered on TikTok to their Anghami music libraries. The collaboration follows the feature's successful global rollout in 2024, which has generated over a billion track saves, and coincides with Believe's expansion of Artist Services in the region and Nancy Ajram's new album release.

articles.title: ASML's stock price is dropping today after the semiconductor giant issued this critical warning about 2026
articles.summary: ASML's stock price dropped significantly after the company reported Q2 2025 results that beat expectations but issued a cautious outlook for 2026. CEO Christophe Fouquet stated that while they prepare for growth in 2026, they cannot confirm it due to increasing uncertainties from macroeconomic and geopolitical developments, including potential tariffs. This warning overshadowed strong financial performance and a 15% growth forecast for 2025, leading to a premarket stock decline.

articles.title: US stock market future slips as Trump’s 30% tariffs rattle global trade; Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq dip while Bo
articles.summary: US stock futures slipped after President Donald Trump announced 30% tariffs on imports from the EU and Mexico, beginning August 1st, stoking global trade tensions. Investors are also closely watching second-quarter earnings reports from major banks, upcoming inflation data, and the growing rift between Trump and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Despite the market dip, Boeing saw gains while Apple and Tesla slid, and Bitcoin hit a new record high.

articles.title: Cathie Wood Continues To Back Tesla As Investors Panic Amid Elon Musk's Return To Politics: Calls Robotaxi Bet A Trillion-Dollar Opportunity
articles.summary: Cathie Wood of ARK Invest continues to support Tesla Inc. despite investor panic over Elon Musk's return to politics, reiterating her $2,600 price target, driven by Robotaxis and Optimus. Conversely, Wood has exited her position in Apple Inc. due to slower growth and concerns about its AI strategy following a key executive's departure. Wood has also lauded Tesla as the "largest AI project on earth" and Musk as the "most productive human being," while Apple struggles with its AI race.

articles.title: EchoStar (SATS) CLO Dean Manson sells $825k in shares
articles.summary: EchoStar's Chief Legal Officer, Dean Manson, sold 25,000 shares of Class A Common Stock for $825,000 at a price of $33 per share, near the stock's 52-week high. Prior to this sale, Manson exercised options to acquire the same number of shares at a lower price. This transaction comes amidst significant financial and regulatory challenges for EchoStar, including missed interest payments and an ongoing FCC review of its 5G network buildout.

articles.title: Apple, Visa, and Mastercard win dismissal of merchant antitrust lawsuit over payment fees
articles.summary: A U.S. judge dismissed an antitrust lawsuit against Apple, Visa, and Mastercard, which alleged they colluded to stifle competition in the payments network market and inflated merchant fees. The judge found insufficient evidence that Apple unlawfully refused to launch a competing payment network. However, the merchants were given the opportunity to amend their lawsuit to strengthen their claims.

articles.title: IVV Is a Great Choice for Most, but I Like SPLG ETF Better
articles.summary: This article compares two S&P 500 tracking ETFs, IVV (iShares Core S&P 500 ETF) and SPLG (SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF), highlighting that both are excellent, low-cost options for investors. While their holdings are nearly identical, the author prefers SPLG due to its slightly lower expense ratio (0.02% vs. 0.03% for IVV) and more efficient bid-ask spread. The article reinforces Warren Buffett's support for low-cost index funds as a sound investment strategy.

articles.title: Garmin smartwatches add turn-by-turn directions with Google Maps
articles.summary: Garmin has announced that the Google Maps app is now available for free in the Connect IQ Store, bringing turn-by-turn directions to compatible Garmin smartwatches. This new feature allows users to receive navigation prompts directly on their wrist while walking, running, or cycling, keeping their hands free and phone safely in their pocket. The integration also enables fitness enthusiasts to track their activities alongside navigation, syncing data to other health and fitness apps.

articles.title: Fund Giants Put Faith in ‘Trump Put’ to Keep Stock Rally Rolling
articles.summary: Major asset managers like Invesco, Fidelity International, and JPMorgan Asset Management are increasing their investments in risk assets, especially US and Asian technology shares and emerging markets. This bullish strategy is based on the expectation that while Donald Trump may threaten economic disruption, he will ultimately pull back, allowing the stock rally to continue.

articles.title: 'Overvalued' AI Stocks Like Nvidia, Microsoft May Trigger Market Crash Worse Than The Dot-Com Bubble, Economist Warns
articles.summary: A leading economist warns that the current AI stock frenzy, particularly in companies like Nvidia and Microsoft, represents a market overvaluation potentially worse than the dot-com bubble of 1999. Torsten Sløk of Apollo Global Management notes that the top 10 S&P 500 companies are more overvalued now than during the 1990s IT bubble, suggesting a major market crash could be triggered if these inflated promises are not met. Other prominent figures like Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and billionaire Ray Dalio have also expressed similar concerns regarding a potential AI bubble.

articles.title: Apple, Visa and Mastercard win dismissal of merchant antitrust lawsuit over payment fees
articles.summary: A U.S. judge has dismissed a merchant antitrust lawsuit accusing Apple, Visa, and Mastercard of conspiring to suppress competition in the payments network market and causing inflated transaction fees. The judge ruled that the plaintiffs did not provide enough evidence but allowed them to amend their lawsuit. The lawsuit alleged that Visa and Mastercard paid Apple to prevent it from launching a competing payment network.
